pullRequest.body: Given any `p : ℤ[X]` and `d : ℕ`, there exists some `h : ℚ[X]` such that for any large enough `n : ℕ`, `PowerSeries.coeff ℤ n (p * (@invOneSubPow ℤ _ d))` is equal to `h.eval (n : ℚ)`. This `h` is unique and is called the Hilbert polynomial with respect to `p` and `d` (`Polynomial.hilbert p d`).

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a129851314](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17334/commits/a1298513147f431c3cf1dfddf49b1931be495eb1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Polynomial.Hilbert`|967|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coeff_mul_invOneSubPow_eq_hilbert_eval`
`+ greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd`
`+ greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd_ne_zero`
`+ hilbert`
`+ natDegree_greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd_le`
`+ natDegree_pow_rootMultiplicity_sub_mul_greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd_le`
`+ pow_rootMultiplicity_mul_greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd_eq`
`+ preHilbert`
`+ preHilbert_eq_choose_sub_add`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This module docstring gives no indication of the point of this definition or whether there is anything else to come. Given that I'm your PhD supervisor I know exactly the point, but I think it would be much better if you explained it here! There is nothing wrong with a long module docstring!
`NeZero 1` is not the usual way we express that `R` is nontrivial -- this should be changed to `[Nontrivial R]`.

```suggestion
Given a polynomial `p`, the greatest factor of `p` that is not divisible by `1 - X`.
```
This docstring should be more precise, explaining which sign you are choosing here. Factors are only defined up to units.
These should never have been variables on line 25. They're not used in the definition either. Make them variables later on when you need them.
Do we not have some general theorem saying "if p divides q then the natdegree of p is <= the natdegree of q under some hypotheses (e.g. no zero divisors, q != 0)"?
You have three goals here so should be focussing with \.
Can't you just argue that its degree is `p.rootMultiplicity 1` or is this just as long?
This theorem strikes me as very weird. The LHS is just p/(1-X)^(d+1) right? So the degree is <= p.natDegree - (d+1) and so this theorem is intentionally too weak (if I've understood it correctly).
This just looks pretty much the same as lines 56 to 58. Can you factor out a lemma?
This is the third time you've proved this. Factor it out!
In this section you still use `greatestFactorOneSubNotDvd` four times, and `gFOSND` only three times. You should make up your mind about which one you want to use.

This proof feels far too long (although maybe I'm just being optimistic) but my first reaction is to wonder whether you really want a variable n here with k<=n, Why not have a natural variable t and let n=k+t? Then you don't have the inequality, you don't have natural subtraction, the result is mathematically equivalent, and probably the proof can get shorter.

```suggestion
A polynomial which makes it easier to define the Hilbert polynomial. See also the theorem
```

This erw should be removed (because right now the culture is to argue that they're evil). You should add the lemma saying that (1-X)^(d+1)*invOneSubPow d = 1 in the invOneSubPow file and rewrite with this instead.
If you remove the down-arrow it still works.
Hopefully this can be golfed! Maybe ask on Zulip in the Is there code for X channel?

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Polynomial/Hilbert): the Hilbert polynomial in terms of a natural number `d` and a polynomial `p : ℤ[X]`
